summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, denying Maxwell's request to summon the warden to personally address her conditions of confinement. The order instead mandates the government to provide written status updates every 60 days regarding Maxwell's access to legal materials and communication with her defense counsel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who raised concerns about her conditions of confinement at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued the order denying Maxwell's request and mandating government status updates.

persons.name: Heriberto Tellez
persons.context: The warden of the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) whom Maxwell requested be summoned to personally respond to questions about her confinement conditions.

connections.description: Maxwell is a detainee at the facility where Tellez is the warden; she requested his personal appearance to address her confinement conditions.
Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issued this order regarding her detention conditions.

events.title: Defendant's Letter on Confinement Conditions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell submitted a letter to the court raising concerns about her conditions of confinement at the MDC.

events.title: MDC Legal Counsel Response
events.description: Legal counsel for the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) submitted a letter to the court responding to Maxwell's concerns.

events.title: Defendant's Response to MDC Letter
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell responded to the MDC's letter, reiterating her request for Warden Tellez to be summoned.

events.title: Court Order Denying Request
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued an order denying Maxwell's request to summon the warden and mandating 60-day government status updates on her confinement conditions.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court denied Ghislaine Maxwell's request to have Warden Heriberto Tellez summoned to personally address her conditions of confinement.
The court ordered the government to submit written status updates every 60 days detailing any material changes to Maxwell's confinement conditions.
The mandated updates must specifically cover Maxwell's access to legal materials (mail, email) and her ability to communicate with her defense counsel.
The order resolves the defendant's motion documented in Docket Number 75.
